search_information.query_displayed: Open Schools and Achievement: Extended Tests of a Finding of No Relationship McPartland, James M. Epstein, Joyce L. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Open schools and achievement: Extended tests of a finding of no relationship
organic_results.snippet: Several extended tests of the relationship between the" openness" of a school's instructional program and student achievement fail to show sizeable or consistent positive or negative effects in a survey of 6,225 students from 39 elementary and secondary schools. Conventional analyses of the immediate impact of openness on student achievement, net of family background, show that openness accounts for less than two percent of the variance in test scores and that the direction of the relationship is inconsistent across four grades …

publication_info.summary: JM McPartland, JL Epstein - Sociology of Education, 1977 - JSTOR
